title: Sexuality Studies
description: Sexuality in a cultural and historical context. Changing definitions of human subjectivity. The cultural and social regimes that control and create sexuality (including the 'invention' of homo/heterosexuality and the social, legal and political systems that define sexual ab/normality). Contemporary issues of sexual orientation and topics of sexuality in relation to gender and race. 4 seminars. Fulfills GE D5. Crosslisted as WGS/HNRSÂ 340.
prerequisites: Completion of GE Area A and one course from lower division Area D
